item.title: CASIO Loopy, RGB mod possible ?
item.description: RGB video, possibly the best you can get video quality wise in the analog realm. Most people back then relied on Composite but a few (including most people in France) had RGB video.

item.title: OpenLara Port ideas (Part 1)
item.description: In late 2021, XProger ported his OpenLara engine to the 3DO. https://twitter.com/XProger_san/status/1453488510833414152 The port is quite amazing and definitively worth a look if you own a 3DO.

item.title: Re-updating my blog
item.description: So yet again, i have decided to switch to another blog solution. I pretty much forgot about the ones i used in details but basically it went something like :

item.title: More work on SMS Plus GX
item.description: Hello guys, Another quick update on SMS Plus GX ! Unfortunately, i realised that i broke save states along the way some time ago, and it took me some time to fix it.

item.title: My fork of SMS Plus GX (itself based on SMS Plus)
item.description: Hello guys, i thought i would write this post to reflect me working my fork of SMS Plus and the progress and stuff i made on it.

item.title: More RS-97, bittboy news
item.description: Hello guys, hope you had a great year. (A bit late for that but meh) If you follow my stuff on Dingoonity & youtube, you may have noticed that i got a bittboy and ported some stuff to it.

item.title: Back to N64 stuff and RS-97 news
item.description: So it’s been a while again since i wrote anything on here. I thought i might as well talk about what i’ve been doing recently !

item.title: RS-97 stuff and more
item.description: After getting 2 RS-97, i worked on a new custom firmware for the RS-97. It took me a while, and it was quite painful but here it is for all the revisions as Internal :

item.title: Western Ideals : New (last) Pebble game
item.description: Again, it’s been a while. I did several things since then : I have released a port of Evil Australians for the Atari Falcon.

item.title: Update - Some Changes
item.description: It’s been a while since i have not done anything, even development-wise. Sadly, i have some real-life issues so i could not do much.

item.title: Important! Major changes
item.description: Hello guys ! A forum where i was very active, codewalr.us, is talking about shutting down after 2 important staff members quit codewalrus.

item.title: Yu-Gi-Oh! Reshef of Destruction - Review
item.description: Yu-Gi-Oh : Reshef of Destruction was first released in 2003 in Japan but was later released the next year for Europe & the US.

item.title: Yu-Gi-Oh! GX Academy - Review
item.description: After the abomination that was Reshef of Destruction, i decided to see if Konami learned from their mistakes on the same platform.

item.title: A look at Android-x86
item.description: Android-x86 is a project that intended to port Android to the x86 architecture. Before even Android-x86, Google had released an Android emulator that’s actually running x86 binaries for performance reasons

item.title: Yu-Gi-Oh Games
item.description: Yu-Gi-Oh was at first only a Manga. Only in the late nineties did they agree to expand the series to make real cards, anime and of course, video games.

item.title: Update Blog
DellardOS 1.0 Rainbow Dash - Some history
item.description: DellardOS, the systemd-free Devuan distribution, is being resurrected ! After so many months neglecting it, i have decided to revive it and fix some of its shortcomings.

item.title: Fire HD 7 - Review
item.description: The Amazon Fire HD 7” is a FireOS tablet released in 2014.) At 39$ refurbished (50€ in Europe), it is one of the cheapest tablet you can get out there.

item.title: Older devices - Sony Xperia X8
item.description: The Sony Xperia X8 was first announced in June 2010 and released in September the same year. It was quite a low-end device, even for its time.

item.title: Older devices - Sony Xperia Neo V
item.description: The Sony Xperia Neo V was released on October 2011. It was a cheaper alternative to the Sony Xperia Neo released previously in March of the same year.

item.title: Older devices - LG Optimus L3 E400
item.description: The LG Optimus L3 E400 is an Android device first released on February 2012. Even back when it was released, it was a fairly low-end device.

item.title: Rubby Bird 100 - Official Release
item.description: I am proud to announce the release of Rubby Bird 100, the sequel to Rubby Bird ! You thought rubbing one bird was easy enough ?

item.title: KillMinds - Official Release
item.description: It is now available for Android (Google Play Store) and Sailfish OS. A Firefox OS version was finished but it is currently waiting Mozilla’s aproval.

item.title: Re-installed my blog (again)
item.description: Due to Ghost being a piece of shit, including : No ability to have comments Upgrading taking more than 512 Mb of RAM Among others…

item.title: About
item.description: You will find me rambling about my work, hobbies and sometimes personal views here.
